p: To understand projected changes in the frequency and intensity of HWs and their potential negative impacts on public health a detailed knowledge of the projected changes in air temperature distribution is fundamental [ 64]. A consistent increase in the frequency and intensity of HWs for the three selected cities was detected by the use of common climate change indices, recommended by the WMO and is in line with comparable results from different working groups [ 65, 66, 67]. Even if anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions could be completely stopped, a continuous warming will take place over the next few decades.
